chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: My brethren, be not many masters, knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation.
items.plainText: My brethren, be not many masters, knowing that we shall receive the greater condemnation.

items.text: For in many things we offend all. If any man offend not in word, the same is a perfect man, and able also to bridle the whole body.
items.plainText: For in many things we offend all. If any man offend not in word, the same is a perfect man, and able also to bridle the whole body.

items.text: Behold, we put bits in the horses' mouths, that they may obey us; and we turn about their whole body.
items.plainText: Behold, we put bits in the horses' mouths, that they may obey us; and we turn about their whole body.

items.text: Behold also the ships, which though they be so great, and are driven of fierce winds, yet are they turned about with a very small helm, whithersoever the governor listeth.
items.plainText: Behold also the ships, which though they be so great, and are driven of fierce winds, yet are they turned about with a very small helm, whithersoever the governor listeth.

items.text: Even so the tongue is a little member, and boasteth great things. Behold, how great a matter a little fire kindleth!
items.plainText: Even so the tongue is a little member, and boasteth great things. Behold, how great a matter a little fire kindleth!

items.text: And the tongue is a fire, a world of iniquity: so is the tongue among our members, that it defileth the whole body, and setteth on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell.
items.plainText: And the tongue is a fire, a world of iniquity: so is the tongue among our members, that it defileth the whole body, and setteth on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell.

items.text: For every kind of beasts, and of birds, and of serpents, and of things in the sea, is tamed, and hath been tamed of mankind:
items.plainText: For every kind of beasts, and of birds, and of serpents, and of things in the sea, is tamed, and hath been tamed of mankind:

items.text: But the tongue can no man tame; it is an unruly evil, full of deadly poison.
items.plainText: But the tongue can no man tame; it is an unruly evil, full of deadly poison.

items.text: Therewith bless we God, even the Father; and therewith curse we men, which are made after the similitude of God.
items.plainText: Therewith bless we God, even the Father; and therewith curse we men, which are made after the similitude of God.

items.text: Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing. My brethren, these things ought not so to be.
items.plainText: Out of the same mouth proceedeth blessing and cursing. My brethren, these things ought not so to be.

items.text: Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet water and bitter?
items.plainText: Doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet water and bitter?

items.text: Can the fig tree, my brethren, bear olive berries? either a vine, figs? so can no fountain both yield salt water and fresh.
items.plainText: Can the fig tree, my brethren, bear olive berries? either a vine, figs? so can no fountain both yield salt water and fresh.

items.text: Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.
items.plainText: Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him shew out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.

items.text: But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts, glory not, and lie not against the truth.
items.plainText: But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts, glory not, and lie not against the truth.

items.text: This wisdom descendeth not from above, but is earthly, sensual, devilish.
items.plainText: This wisdom descendeth not from above, but is earthly, sensual, devilish.

items.text: For where envying and strife is, there is confusion and every evil work.
items.plainText: For where envying and strife is, there is confusion and every evil work.

items.text: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, and easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.
items.plainText: But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, and easy to be intreated, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.

items.text: And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace.
items.plainText: And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace.
